de.nec.nle.siafu.types

Class FlatData

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.nec.nle.siafu.types.FlatData

  • public class FlatData
extends Object
    An instance of FlatData represents a Publishable object in flattenned form. In essence, flattened data is a human readable equivalent of java standard serialized data.

    In the typical case, a FlatData object is created from flattened data coming, for instance, from persisted storage, a text file, etc... You can then "blow" the data back into a full fledged Publishable using the rebuild() method.

    The standard way Siafu flattens data is by using the form ClassName:field1#field2#...#fieldN but developers are free to choose any form, provided that it becomes a String, and it begins with ClassName:, so that the factory can identify the right type through reflection.

    Note that ClassName is either a fully qualified class name (including the package) or simply a Class name, in which case the package is assumed to be de.nec.nle.siafu.types.

    Author:
    Miquel Martin

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_PACKAGE
      The package to append to the class name in the flattened data, if none is provided.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public String getData()
        Get the flattened data encapsulated by this object.
        Returns:
        the String of flattened data.

      • rebuild

        public Publishable rebuild()
        Blows up the data back into a Publishable object from its flattened state. If the class name does not specify a package, de.nec.nle.siafu.types is assumed.
        Returns:
        the object represented by the flattened data.
        Throws:
        InvalidFlatDataException - if the flat data can not be parsed, or the class it represents is not available, has no appropriate constructor, or throws any other Exception

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Get a human readable (and rebuildable) representation of this flattened data.

        Returns:
        the data string
